2025-08-01: St. Alphonsus Liguori (1696–1787) founded the Redemptorists and dedicated his life to preaching missions. His deep devotion to the Blessed Virgin Mary and the Eucharist continues to inspire. Reflection: May we learn from his zeal to bring Christ’s mercy to all.
2025-08-06: The Transfiguration reveals Christ’s divine glory to Peter, James, and John. Historically celebrated in the East since the 4th century, it strengthens faith in Christ’s divinity. Reflection: May we also listen to the voice of the Father: 'This is my beloved Son; listen to Him.'
2025-08-10: St. Lawrence, a Roman deacon martyred in 258, is remembered for his courage and charity, especially for presenting the poor as the Church’s true treasure. Reflection: May we value spiritual riches above worldly possessions.
2025-08-15: The Assumption of Mary, defined as dogma in 1950, proclaims her being taken body and soul into heaven. Devotionally, it is a sign of hope for all Christians. Reflection: Mary’s glorification points us toward our own eternal destiny in Christ.
2025-08-20: St. Bernard of Clairvaux (1090–1153), a Cistercian abbot, renewed monastic life and guided the Church with wisdom. Reflection: His love for Mary and Christ reminds us to root our spirituality in humility and devotion.
2025-08-22: The Queenship of Mary affirms her role beside Christ the King. Instituted by Pope Pius XII in 1954, it highlights her intercession for the Church. Reflection: Let us entrust ourselves to her motherly protection.
2025-08-24: St. Bartholomew, one of the Twelve Apostles, preached the Gospel to distant lands. Tradition holds he was martyred for the faith. Reflection: May we witness to Christ courageously in our own lives.
2025-09-08: The Nativity of Mary celebrates the dawn of salvation. By her birth, the world rejoices at the coming of the Mother of the Savior. Reflection: As Mary’s birth brought joy, may our lives bring Christ to others.
2025-09-14: The Exaltation of the Holy Cross recalls St. Helena’s discovery of the True Cross in 326. Devotionally, it celebrates Christ’s victory over sin and death. Reflection: We glory in the Cross of our Lord Jesus Christ.
2025-09-15: Our Lady of Sorrows honors Mary’s sharing in her Son’s suffering. Reflection: Standing at the foot of the Cross, she teaches us compassion and perseverance.
2025-09-21: St. Matthew, Apostle and Evangelist, was called from his work as a tax collector to follow Christ. Reflection: His Gospel continues to proclaim the Good News of the Kingdom.
2025-09-29: Saints Michael, Gabriel, and Raphael are archangels who serve God’s mission as protectors, messengers, and healers. Reflection: Let us call on their aid in our daily battles of faith.
